intro: Verbesina olsenii, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal habitats, thriving in sandy soils and exposed conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. Verbesina olsenii plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for native pollinators.
